20#ifndef __I_SOUND__
21#define __I_SOUND__
22
23#include "doomtype.h"
24
25// so that the individual game logic and sound driver code agree
26#define NORM_PITCH 127
27
28//
29// SoundFX struct.
30//
31typedef struct sfxinfo_struct sfxinfo_t;
32
33struct sfxinfo_struct
34{
35 // tag name, used for hexen.
36 const char *tagname;
37
38 // lump name. If we are running with use_sfx_prefix=true, a
39 // 'DS' (or 'DP' for PC speaker sounds) is prepended to this.
40
41 char name[9];
42
43 // Sfx priority
44 int priority;
45
46 // referenced sound if a link
47 sfxinfo_t *link;
48
49 // pitch if a link (Doom), whether to pitch-shift (Hexen)
50 int pitch;
51
52 // volume if a link
53 int volume;
54
55 // this is checked every second to see if sound
56 // can be thrown out (if 0, then decrement, if -1,
57 // then throw out, if > 0, then it is in use)
58 int usefulness;
59
60 // lump number of sfx
61 int lumpnum;
62
63 // Maximum number of channels that the sound can be played on
64 // (Heretic)
65 int numchannels;
66
67 // data used by the low level code
68 void *driver_data;
69};
70
71//
72// MusicInfo struct.
73//
74typedef struct
75{
76 // up to 6-character name
77 const char *name;
78
79 // lump number of music
80 int lumpnum;
81
82 // music data
83 void *data;
84
85 // music handle once registered
86 void *handle;
87
88} musicinfo_t;
89
90typedef enum
91{
92 SNDDEVICE_NONE = 0,
93 SNDDEVICE_PCSPEAKER = 1,
94 SNDDEVICE_ADLIB = 2,
95 SNDDEVICE_SB = 3,
96 SNDDEVICE_PAS = 4,
97 SNDDEVICE_GUS = 5,
98 SNDDEVICE_WAVEBLASTER = 6,
99 SNDDEVICE_SOUNDCANVAS = 7,
100 SNDDEVICE_GENMIDI = 8,
101 SNDDEVICE_AWE32 = 9,
102 SNDDEVICE_CD = 10,
103 SNDDEVICE_FSYNTH = 11,
104} snddevice_t;
105
106// Interface for sound modules
107
108typedef struct
109{
110 // List of sound devices that this sound module is used for.
111
112 const snddevice_t *sound_devices;
113 int num_sound_devices;
114
115 // Initialise sound module
116 // Returns true if successfully initialised
117
118 boolean (*Init)(boolean use_sfx_prefix);
119
120 // Shutdown sound module
121
122 void (*Shutdown)(void);
123
124 // Returns the lump index of the given sound.
125
126 int (*GetSfxLumpNum)(sfxinfo_t *sfxinfo);
127
128 // Called periodically to update the subsystem.
129
130 void (*Update)(void);
131
132 // Update the sound settings on the given channel.
133
134 void (*UpdateSoundParams)(int channel, int vol, int sep);
135
136 // Start a sound on a given channel. Returns the channel id
137 // or -1 on failure.
138
139 int (*StartSound)(sfxinfo_t *sfxinfo, int channel, int vol, int sep, int pitch);
140
141 // Stop the sound playing on the given channel.
142
143 void (*StopSound)(int channel);
144
145 // Query if a sound is playing on the given channel
146
147 boolean (*SoundIsPlaying)(int channel);
148
149 // Called on startup to precache sound effects (if necessary)
150
151 void (*CacheSounds)(sfxinfo_t *sounds, int num_sounds);
152
153} sound_module_t;
154
155void I_InitSound(boolean use_sfx_prefix);
156void I_ShutdownSound(void);
157int I_GetSfxLumpNum(sfxinfo_t *sfxinfo);
158void I_UpdateSound(void);
159void I_UpdateSoundParams(int channel, int vol, int sep);
160int I_StartSound(sfxinfo_t *sfxinfo, int channel, int vol, int sep, int pitch);
161void I_StopSound(int channel);
162boolean I_SoundIsPlaying(int channel);
163void I_PrecacheSounds(sfxinfo_t *sounds, int num_sounds);
164
165// Interface for music modules
166
167typedef struct
168{
169 // List of sound devices that this music module is used for.
170
171 const snddevice_t *sound_devices;
172 int num_sound_devices;
173
174 // Initialise the music subsystem
175
176 boolean (*Init)(void);
177
178 // Shutdown the music subsystem
179
180 void (*Shutdown)(void);
181
182 // Set music volume - range 0-127
183
184 void (*SetMusicVolume)(int volume);
185
186 // Pause music
187
188 void (*PauseMusic)(void);
189
190 // Un-pause music
191
192 void (*ResumeMusic)(void);
193
194 // Register a song handle from data
195 // Returns a handle that can be used to play the song
196
197 void *(*RegisterSong)(void *data, int len);
198
199 // Un-register (free) song data
200
201 void (*UnRegisterSong)(void *handle);
202
203 // Play the song
204
205 void (*PlaySong)(void *handle, boolean looping);
206
207 // Stop playing the current song.
208
209 void (*StopSong)(void);
210
211 // Query if music is playing.
212
213 boolean (*MusicIsPlaying)(void);
214
215 // Invoked periodically to poll.
216
217 void (*Poll)(void);
218} music_module_t;
219
220void I_InitMusic(void);
221void I_ShutdownMusic(void);
222void I_SetMusicVolume(int volume);
223void I_PauseSong(void);
224void I_ResumeSong(void);
225void *I_RegisterSong(void *data, int len);
226void I_UnRegisterSong(void *handle);
227void I_PlaySong(void *handle, boolean looping);
228void I_StopSong(void);
229boolean I_MusicIsPlaying(void);
230
231boolean IsMid(byte *mem, int len);
232boolean IsMus(byte *mem, int len);

253} opl_driver_ver_t;
